availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Tribble (Madison County, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Son of John Tribble and Martha White Tribble. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Madison County in 1850. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 2, p. 249B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 2, p. 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 109.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, p. 20.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Union, p. 7.
Find A Grave, "John Calhoun Tribble (1839-1886)," Memorial #20003384, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/20003384 (accessed December 8, 2018).
